docs.lead_paragraph: Brown University has unveiled a $100 million plan aimed at boosting diversity on its Rhode Island campus over the next 10 years, including doubling the number of faculty members from minority and other underrepresented populations.

headline.main: Brown University Unveils $100 Million Plan to Address Campus Diversity
headline.print_headline: Brown University Unveils $100 Million Plan to Address Campus Diversity

docs.snippet: Brown University has unveiled a $100 million plan aimed at boosting diversity on its Rhode Island campus over the next 10 years, including doubling the number of faculty members from minority and other underrepresented populations.

docs.lead_paragraph: Carmen Gonzalez came to New York from Puerto Rico and made a life for herself, but her professional, financial and personal successes crumbled when her spine condition worsened and she underwent two operations.

headline.main: Fighting Scoliosis, and Dreaming of Having Her Own Business Again
headline.print_headline: A Dream of Owning a Business Again After Being Derailed by Severe Scoliosis

docs.abstract: Carmen Gonzalez of Brooklyn is provided with funds to buy laptop and printer to aid in her goal of starting business by Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens, one of agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
docs.snippet: Carmen Gonzalez came to New York from Puerto Rico and made a life for herself, but her professional, financial and personal successes crumbled when her spine condition worsened and she underwent two operations.

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Friday hosted a forum to address ways in which the government could help protect against high pharmaceutical costs.

headline.main: Administration Is Seeking Ways to Keep Prescription Drugs Affordable
headline.print_headline: Obama Administration Seeks Ways to Rein In Pharmaceutical Costs

docs.abstract: Obama administration begins building arguments for federal intervention to protect consumers from soaring prescription drug costs during daylong forum held to solicit ideas from consumer advocates, doctors, drugmakers, insurers and employers.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration on Friday hosted a forum to address ways in which the government could help protect against high pharmaceutical costs.

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Concerned about an adverse effect on choice and price in medical care, consumer advocates and antitrust experts want state insurance commissioners to weigh in on two major merger proposals.

headline.main: States Urged to Review Health Insurer Mergers
headline.print_headline: States Urged to Review Big Health Insurers’ Merger Proposals

docs.abstract: Consumer advocates and antitrust experts, concerned that consumers may be left with fewer health care choices and higher prices, are urging state regulators to carefully check proposed mergers of big health insurance companies.
docs.snippet: Concerned about an adverse effect on choice and price in medical care, consumer advocates and antitrust experts want state insurance commissioners to weigh in on two major merger proposals.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Proposes Middle-Class Tax Cut Tied to Health Care

docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton proposed a tax credit for those who face excessive and unexpected health care costs, the first part of multipronged approach to tax relief to be unveiled in the coming days, according to her campaign.
docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton proposed a tax credit for those who face excessive and unexpected health care costs, the first part of multipronged approach to tax relief to be unveiled in the coming days, according to her campaign.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton is spending the coming weeks promoting a series of tax benefits that she says will help boost the take-home pay for middle class families.

headline.main: Clinton Proposing Tax Credit to Help With Heath Care Costs
headline.print_headline: Clinton Proposing Tax Credit to Help With Heath Care Costs

docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton is spending the coming weeks promoting a series of tax benefits that she says will help boost the take-home pay for middle class families.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health insurers rallied Friday to ease investor and customer concerns about the Affordable Care Act's public insurance exchanges a day after the nation's biggest insurer questioned its future in that still-developing market.

headline.main: Insurers Reassure Investors About ACA Exchange Business
headline.print_headline: Insurers Reassure Investors About ACA Exchange Business

docs.snippet: Health insurers rallied Friday to ease investor and customer concerns about the Affordable Care Act's public insurance exchanges a day after the nation's biggest insurer questioned its future in that still-developing market.

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's biggest insurers will be exempt from having their most important indicator of financial health externally audited under proposals issued by the Bank of England on Friday.

headline.main: Big Insurers Get Key Exemption in Proposed British Audit Rules
headline.print_headline: Big Insurers Get Key Exemption in Proposed British Audit Rules

docs.snippet: Britain's biggest insurers will be exempt from having their most important indicator of financial health externally audited under proposals issued by the Bank of England on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. health insurers Aetna Inc and Anthem Inc on Friday sought to reassure investors that their Obamacare businesses had not worsened after UnitedHealth Group Inc warned of mounting losses in that sector.

headline.main: Aetna, Anthem Reassure Investors on Obamacare Business
headline.print_headline: Aetna, Anthem Reassure Investors on Obamacare Business

docs.snippet: U.S. health insurers Aetna Inc and Anthem Inc on Friday sought to reassure investors that their Obamacare businesses had not worsened after UnitedHealth Group Inc warned of mounting losses in that sector.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans’ panic over Syrian refugees fits a pattern.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column accuses Republican politicians of panicked and irrational reactions to terrorist attacks in Paris; contends Republican calls for ban on Syrian refugees are both cruel and ineffective; submits Republican propensity for panic is linked to apocalyptic mind-set that has grown in party during Obama years; says outlook explains why outsider candidates like Donald Trump have surged after attack.
docs.snippet: Republicans’ panic over Syrian refugees fits a pattern.
